definition: to pick and choose/to select
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to choose/to pick/to sort out/to pick up

sentences.english: He wanted some one who wasn't thinking of a choice or something better.
sentences.chinese: 他想要一个不想挑拣或者不想找更好的事做的人。

sentences.english: He says beggars mustn't be choosers.
sentences.chinese: 他说，要饭的哪能挑挑拣拣。

sentences.english: The hour-wives pick he fruit over-carefully before making their minds up which to buy.
sentences.chinese: 主妇们在决定买水果之前仔细地挑拣一番。

sentences.english: He selected a cat as pet following him.
sentences.chinese: 他挑拣出一保猫作为宠物陪伴自己。

sentences.english: Never try to date too many people just to try them out.
sentences.chinese: 千成不要只是为了挑挑拣拣约会很多人。

sentences.english: He picked out a cat as a pet to accompany him .
sentences.chinese: 他挑拣出一保猫作为宠物陪伴自己。

sentences.english: And I can't pick and choose now as I could when I was younger.
sentences.chinese: 这会儿我可不好照年轻时候挑挑拣拣啦。

sentences.english: Pick over the lentils and remove any little stones.
sentences.chinese: 仔细挑拣豆子，把小石子拣出去。

sentences.english: I began to pick and choose.
You can't pick and choose which laws you obey.
sentences.chinese: 法律条款是不由你挑挑拣拣的。

sentences.english: And employers are still being very cautious and choosy when it comes to hiring.
sentences.chinese: 而且雇主们在招聘中仍然非常谨慎和挑拣。

to choose/to pick/to sort out/to pick up

to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
to gather/to rake together/to pile up
to lay sth out to dry
slender
to purchase/to buy/to do one's shopping/purchasing agent/buyer
to pile up/to stack up
greens/vegetables/vegetable side dish
to pick the edible part of vegetables
large wicker basket
to look for/to explore/to probe
to look after/to tend (one's crops, garden, livestock, pets etc)/to repair
to pick up/to gather
